runs.comm: 6 ft 7 in Boyd lands the first ball on target, bouncing delivery, angling away from the off stump, left alone
gets forward to push the ball close on the off side and they rush across for a very risky signle .. Had the throw found the stumps, Junaid would have been out ... Nervy start
edged over the lone slip. Boyd's extra bounce produced the edge on the cut but it also meant it flew high over the fielder.
lands it fuller and sees it disappear through wide mid-off. Junaid moved forward to flash it in the air but well to the right of mid-off
drags back the length, hits the back of length, bouncing into the rib cage , tucked to square leg for a single
full in length, on the middle and leg, turned to short fine-leg . 10 runs from the first over.
drifts to the pad and Junaid flicks it uppishly but wide of the short fine-leg fielder. It appeared as if he wanted to flick it over square leg but ended up dragging it finer
slips further down the leg side. Junaid tries to repeat his earlier shot but can't reach it

Junaid combusts. It was full and straight, he went for the big lofted hit down the ground but got too much under the ball and hit it straight up. It swirled in the air as it came down but the fielder did well to cling on to it.
Again, on the leg stump line, tries to flick, misses and is hit on the pad
Slashed away in style. Outside off stump and Tamim lashed out at the width, hitting it over cover point
back to the leg stump line, again Tamim fails to connect with the flick - he is going really hard at the shot - and the ball bounds off the pad
good delivery, straightening on the middle and off line, Tamim was looking to force it away to the off side but got cramped and ended up jabbing it to the off side
length delivery on the middle and leg, tapped to the on side for a single
mistimes the drive but will pick up a single
banged in short of length, angling away from Tamil who goes for the pull but because of the extra bounce doesn't find much power behind the shot and the ball rolls to mid-on
Top shot. It was not all that short, it was not all that wide - in fact pretty close to the off stump - but Tamim stayed adjacent to the line to cut it superbly to backward point boundary
His problems with the leg side shots continue. Again misses the flick off the hips and is hit on the pad
quite similar to the four ball earlier, Tamim some how creates room where none exists and cuts but there is an extra fielder now in that point region and it's cut off
Superb delivery. Top leg cutter. It landed on middle and off line and cut away past the outside edge

Dropped by Kevin at first slip. It moved away from Ash who hung his bat out ala Kris Srikkanth, even opening the bat-face to almost guide to first slip. It should have been easily caught but what a clanger ..
lovely slower one, loopy delivery around the off stump, stabbed away to the off side
backs away outside leg, Trent follows him with a yorker, dug out to the off side
another neat little slower one, Tamim is made to wait for an eternity and he adjusts to defend it to the on side
fullish, around the off stump, Ashraful drives it straight to mid-off. Well timed stroke but didn't get the placement right.

Ash shuffled across towards the off stump and pulled the short-of-length delivery over deep square leg in style. This is the danger time now for Ash.. After the boundary , he is known to lose his head
And very nearly so. He moved outside leg stump and went for a slog across the line and missed it completely.
really full up, dragged through the on side for couple of runs
Hit in the V Ash! That's the way to do it. Again, that slight shuffle towards off and he lifted the length delivery over mid-on
just short of blockhole, Ashraful bent his knees to square drive it to cover point
almost yorker length outside off, jabbed out to cover
low dipping full toss on the off and middle, driven uppishly but short of mid-off

O Ash what have you done? Action replay of the earlier drop. He opened the bat-face and almost deliberately guided it straight to first slip. He was given a reprieve earlier but has committed the same mistake. Joy in the Irish camp.
on a length, moving away from Shakib who guides it to backward point
really slow ... slower one, short of length, Shakib waited and waited before swatting it past square leg
full up, driven towards mid-off and he runs with the shot
floated outside off stump, square driven to deep point region for a single
flighted on the middle, turned to midwicket
decides to take the aerial route and lunges out to lift this to wide long-on boundary
quicker, spinning into the pads, turned past square leg for a single
full, just outside off stump, no foot movement, just lunges out to wrist it to square leg
on the middle and leg, driven to long-on. 50 up.

Irish are dancing away in the aisles. Lovely catch by Wilson at long-on. Shakib lofted it high in the air and Wilson back-pedaled, held his balance and took a sharp catch. Fine stuff from Ireland. Johnston is having a great day with the ball.
slower one on the middle and leg, turned to backward square leg
banged in short, testing him out and pulled over square leg
full delivery, pushed to the off side for a single
gets behind the line of the length delivery to turn it to wide midwicket

Johnston almost bags his fourth wicket. He induced a leading edge back down the pitch and he dived to his right but couldn't reach it. What a fine spell this has been from the veteran. Great to watch.
well outside off stump, cut away to deep point region for a single
well-flighted delivery on the middle, full, turned to midwicket
tossed up again, turns in towards off stump, goes back to cut it past backward point
slows it up even further, on the off stump line, tries to work it to the on side but gets a leading edge down the track
again slow through the air, tapped past square leg
quicker one this time, full again, whipped through midwicket

Tamim is run out! Comedy of errors. It was turned to the on side and there is confusion right away. Yes and no. The keeper rushes out, picks the ball and darts it to the bowler. More drama. Tamim loses the bat and the bowler fails to collect the throw. Tamim rushes on, trying to jump into his crease. The ball bounds off the bowler's body and drops on to the stumps, catching Tamim just short of the crease!
leans forward to defend to the on side
flighted full, driven uppishly back to the bowler
again driven back to the bowler
tired of finding the bowler when driving straight, he plays a reverse paddle sweep this time and gets it past the short third-man fielder
slow in the air, floated outside off stump, driven to long-on
length delivery on the middle and off, defended back down the pitch
moving towards the hips, tucked to backward square leg

Awesome work from Neil O'Brien. What a fine stumping , standing up to the mediumpacer. It was a full length delivery, the batsman went for the big swing across the line and missed it. The back foot was well inside the crease but while finishing the stroke, his back foot was lifted in the air slightly before it came down. In a flash the keeper had removed the bails! What a fine piece of keeping from O'Brien. The third umpire says that's out and what a game Ireland are having.
really full in length, tapped to the off side of the pitch
another fine take from Neil, standing up to gather it cleanly
fuller, straighter, driven towards long-on
comes down the track and on drives for a single
really slow through the air, goes for the sweep, misses and is struck on the pad
drifting in to the middle, turned to midwicket
lovely arm ball, it goes on straight, past the bat. Very good delivery. He really paused prior to the release, finding out the batsman's intentions, before delivering
slightly short, cut past point
dragged through the on side
Nearly another wicket .... It was the ugly slog sweep and Johnson ran back from midwicket but the ball kept going away from him; he threw in a dive but couldn't get to it
lovely slower one, dipping in front of the stumps, pushed out to cover
leans forward to drive to long-on
yorker length outside off, dug out to cover point
length delivery outside off, driven to long-off
reverse sweeps it from the middle stump to deep backward point region
paused prior to the release again, floats it on the middle, swept away for a single
flighted full, swept past square leg
full and on the middle, driven to long-on
turned past square leg for a single, they were looking for the second but the fielding has been sharp today
unfurls the reverse sweep again
really slow again - the spinners in T20 have really got hold of this idea now   - cut away to deep point
turned to backward square leg
drifts in to the pad, worked to the on side
slightly short in length, cut away towards backward point where he over runs it and the ball spins past him!
low full toss outside off, slash and a miss
full again, just outside off stump, goes for the square drive and misses it again
flights outside leg, swept to short fine-leg
What a Irish evening this has been. Another wicket goes down. Full and straight on the off stump, Raqibul tried to go inside-out but missed it completely .. Gone!
leans across to work it to backward square leg for a single
flighted full, on the middle, driven down to long-on
gets forward to on drive to long-on
leans forward to drive through mid-on for a single
Bangladesh continue to hurtle towards nowhere. Mush charged out, going for the big hit, but lifted it straight to long-off...
short of length, cut away to deep point
driven to wide long-on region ..
yorker length just outside off stump, driven to long-off
loopy flighted delivery, nice drift and turn, pushed out with the spin to cover point
leans forward to drive to long-off
yorker length outside off stump, squeezed through cover point for a single
shout for lbw but negated. It was the slower one, tilting in to strike the pad on the off stump line. Hawk eye says it would have gone over middle
another slower one and Mash is too early with his intended swipe across the line
length delivery this time, driven down powerfully but straight to long-off
slips outside leg stump and the paddle shot is out of the shelf. He doesn't connect but  will pick up a boundary despite a desperate fielding effort near the ropes
works it through midwicket for a single
clears the front foot, almost gets into too much of a tangle and almost trapped in front but manages to get bat in front of the back pad and squeezes it out past square leg
backs away a touch to drill a full delivery straight past the bowler and runs away to the boundary.
moves outside leg again, a yorker outside leg, dug out through mid-on for a single
length delivery outside off stump, miscues the intended big hit and it drops short of long-off who runs in but makes a mess of it and gives away an extra run
full pitched, just short of the blockhole, hit back to the bowler
shuffles outside off, shaping for the flick but misses to connect. The furniture is disturbed.
pretty full in length, clears the front foot and heaves it through wide midwicket

full, almost a yorker, on the off stump, driven to long-off ... the bowler doesn't collect properly and they rush across for the extra run. Niel O'Brien, the keeper' rushed out but slipped and is in lots of pain .. He must have twisted his ankle. The physio is out there.
full toss and heaved to wide long-off for couple more
low full toss, on the middle and Mashrafee thumps it superbly over deep midwicket for a vital six
Mashrafee frees his arms ... and runs really hard to come back for the second run ; he dives to get back into the crease
Mash is smashing 'em. He picked the slower one, waited for it, before lifting it high over long-off.
